reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A new holiday classic for me!!
reviews.reviewText: I wish this book was a real life Christmas movie so I could watch it with my entire family, but maybe it’s even better as a book because I can gift it to my teens and then we can reread it every year.These authors are all so incredibly talented on their own, but put them together like this and I’m telling you, this one was pure holiday magic. I loved it and even teared up a bit at the end.Adding this one to my list of holiday favorites.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This started off a little slow for me. I was expecting six independent short stories like Blackout. This time around it was a continuous story with no indication of who wrote what (until the very end). As the friends-to-lovers and second chance romance storylines developed, I became a lot more invested. I was rooting for each couple because they all seemed to genuinely care about each other. I loved the way their stories were all intertwined. The snowstorm in Atlanta was a fun plot. My first winter as an Atlanta resident was marked by Snowpocalypse 2014. I didn’t experience any of the cute, lovey dovey stuff like the kids in Whiteout. I want a do-over!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This story restored my feelings for YA romances. I definitely was going to give up on all but each one of these stories was great. My favorite i actually have not one because they all were memorable, funny, and made me blush. Great work ladies i can’t believe i own blackout and still haven’t read it yet.Btw i love the fact they wouldn’t tell you which author wrote which story. I did some deep diving but only could figure out one of the stories..shoot

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars My middle school self might have liked this
reviews.reviewText: I read this book for a book club featuring Black YA books. Tbh YA romance is not my thing and I went into this book knowing that it may not be for me. I generally I don’t read YA romance because it tends to be really saccharine and melodramatic and not super realistic. There’s nothing wrong with these traits because these books are targeted to a younger audience so it makes sense. But these traits don’t really impress me in a YA book so that’s why I typically avoid YA romance. This book is very has all of the mentioned qualities. It’s saccharine, whimsical, and all about romance. If you’re a person that just loves love then this book may be for you but if not then maybe just leave it alone. I was ready to be finished with it, and I actually don’t think the ending was as fulfilling as it could’ve been consider the all the drama and angst it was building up to. The ending was rushed and fell flat and I don’t say this because you know the MCs will end up together. Even though I knew the MCs would unite, ending just didn’t take it’s time to let us enjoy and soak in the reunion. To me it made the book feel like a huge let down.Overall, it’s a fine book if it has the right audience. If you love all kinds of romance then this book may be for you. For me I know it would be something that wasn’t my cup of tea.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A romance for everyone
reviews.reviewText: This was a gift for my daughter and she said it was a good read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was very cool, I was drawn in on the first page. I liked that all the couples found each other or got back with each other. I liked the snowstorm wreaking havoc with the timelines. The writers are so talented!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I hope it's just as good as black out. Also I'm glad this one is hard cover

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars If you’re looking for a continuation from Blackout, this isn’t it!
reviews.reviewText: Going into this book I thought it was going to be a continuation of the six perspectives told in Blackout! But instead I was met with a fresh group of people in a completely different state. At first I really hated it, but as time progressed I found myself engrossed.Now maybe I’m getting a little too old for these types of books but I hate how unrealistic the ending sought out to be. Typical teenagers don’t know the code to the safe where their phone is and cannot just leave when grounded. Then again typical teenagers don’t have the kind of connections that these kids had.I love that in the end, people got to explain their side and there was forgiveness which is good for a second chance romance but I will say… this is a lesson about not jumping to conclusions!
